  >Hi Natan, 

  Welcome to this group.

  Have you=
 read TANEGASHIMA: The Arrival of Europe in Japan by Olof G. Lidin? publish=
ed by Nias Press (www.niaspress.dk)

  I recently bought a copy from Kinoku=
niya (the Japanese chain bookstore) but have only had time to skim it. It s=
eems to have a very good bibliography and notes.

  Anyone else here read i=
t? Opinions?

  Also some time ago I read Deus Destroyed by George Ellison =
which gives a very dramatic picture of the differences between European and=
 Japanese religious belief and ways of thinking.

  A very useful Japanese =
history bibliography page is

  http://www.oriental.cam.ac.uk/jbib/bibtitle=
.html

  Hope this is of some help - sorry can't write more for you!!

  Gi=
llian
